title: Chile Rejects Left-Leaning Constitution
description: The rejected Constitution would have legalized abortion, adopted universal health care and enshrined more than 100 constitutional rights, a global record.

title: Saskatchewan Stabbing Spree Kills at Least 10
description: The police identified two suspects in attacks that took place along a wide area of a Cree Nation Indigenous reservation and a nearby village in Saskatchewan Province.

title: Vietnam’s Plan for Loudspeaker Broadcasts Meets Resistance
description: The city of Hanoi may revive regular loudspeaker broadcasts, which were routine before most people had TVs or internet access. Residents are wary of bringing them back.

title: Your Monday Briefing: Europe’s Energy Protections
description: Plus Chileans vote on a new constitution and rickshaws lead India’s electric vehicle transition.

title: Europe’s Leaders Vow Economic Relief, Fearing Unrest
description: Germany, Sweden and the Czech Republic announced measures to populations feeling the bite of rising inflation and energy costs tied to war in Ukraine.

title: Blame, Hate and License Plates in a Divided Kosovo Town
description: Tensions between ethnic Albanians and ethnic Serbs have flared in recent months, stoked by a bureaucratic dispute over vehicle tags, testimony to the region’s toxic identity politics.

title: Germany Announces $65 Billion Relief Package Amid Soaring Inflation
description: Berlin aims to ease the burden on citizens facing soaring inflation and surging energy costs that have worsened with Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

title: John Sullivan, the U.S. Ambassador to Russia, Leaves Moscow to Retire
description: John Sullivan managed the U.S. embassy during its most difficult period in decades — when Moscow forced hundreds of employees to leave and after Russia invaded Ukraine.

title: 5 Palestinians, 2 Accused of Spying for Israel, Are Executed in Gaza, Officials Say
description: The Gaza Interior Ministry said that three of the executions were carried out by hanging and the other two by firing squad.

title: Office Drama
description: Labor Day has become a flash point for big companies who want workers to return to the office.

title: Russia’s Unfounded Claims of Secret U.S. Bioweapons Linger On and On
description: Without providing evidence, the Kremlin is pressing allegations that the U.S. operates labs in Ukraine and beyond. This week, it has called an investigative session in Geneva.

title: Fighting Intensifies in South as Russia Bolsters Forces in East
description: There are signs that Russia will send thousands of new troops to the Donbas region in its latest push.

title: In South Korea, a Hit Show Brings Autism Into the Spotlight
description: “Extraordinary Attorney Woo” has raised awareness of autism in South Korea, where developmental disabilities are still a taboo subject for many people.

title: How Russia Relies on Old Tech in  Weapons Aimed at Ukraine
description: Investigators who examined the electronics in Russia’s newest cruise missiles and attack helicopters were surprised to find decades-old technology reused from earlier models.

title: China Threatens Reaction After U.S. Announces Arms Sales to Taiwan
description: A $1.1 billion package would “severely jeopardize” ties, Chinese officials say in demanding that Washington revoke the deal.
